comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: French resistance heroine of this and the next World War. Here she is wearing the Croix de guerre, one of many medals and honors she earned in her lifetime. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Croix_de_guerre_1914-1918_(France) "Émilienne Moreau-Evrard (June 4, 1898 – January 5, 1971) was a French heroine of World War I, a high-profile female member of the “Brutus” Resistance network during World War II and later, a member of the “Assemblée consultative provisoire”. Moreover, she is one of only six women recipients of the Ordre de la Libération." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89milienne_Moreau-Evrard More at: www.ordredelaliberation.fr/fr_compagnon/327.html fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89milienne_Moreau-%C3%89vrard

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Her story in WWI is in The Washington herald., January 23, 1916, Image 30 "WAR MEDAL FOR MODERN JOAN D'ARC" with photo entitled *General Desailly Pins the Croix de Guerre to Emillienne Moreau at Versailles". A less gilded version in The sun., December 05, 1915, SIXTH SECTION, Image 39 "FRANCE HONORS THIS GIRL FOR FIGHTING LIKE A MAN".
